description: Evan Michael Giesemann and Ryan Daniels were married Nov. 10 at the City Winery in Washington. Kiana Hebron, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Ioanna Kefalas, Alexander Niejelow
description: Ioanna Thomas Kefalas and Alexander Nicholas Mark Niejelow were married Nov. 10 at New World Symphony hall in Miami Beach. Shaun Donovan, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Winston Berkman, Joseph Breen
description: Robert Tunstall Winston Berkman and Joseph Lawrence Breen were married Nov. 9 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Shunya Togashi, a staff member of the New York City Clerks Office, officiated. On Nov. 17, Kenji Yoshino, who was a law professor of Mr. Berkman at N.Y.U., will lead the couple in their vows at the Boston Public Library.

title: Kristin Garca, Joseph Lippi
description: Kristin Marie Garca and Joseph David Lippi were married Nov. 10 at Zaza Gardens, an events space and former pickle factory in San Antonio. Matthew Garca, the brides brother, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated, with Kelly Lippi, the grooms sister, who led the vows and exchanging of the rings.

title: This Weeks Wedding Announcements
description: Elizabeth Kapuuwailani Lindsey and George D. Crowley III are to be married Nov. 11 at the Butterfly Conservatory, Fairchild Garden in Coral Gables, Fla. Ashley Jansen, a friend of the couple who was ordained by the Renewal of the Spirit Institute, is to officiate in a nondenominational ceremony.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Sally4Ever and Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
description: Julia Daviss dark comedy Sally4Ever has its HBO debut. And the final episode of Parts Unknown airs on CNN.

title: No One Has Ever Crossed Antarctica Unsupported. Two Men Are Trying Right Now.
description: PUNTA ARENAS, Chile  A weather window opened on Halloween morning, the typical stiff winds and polar fog relenting, and the flight to Antarctica was cleared for takeoff.

title: In Russian Village Swallowed by Sand, Lifes a Beach. Just Not in a Good Way.
description: SHOYNA, Russia  Shoyna, a Russian fishing village on the frigid shores of the White Sea, is slowly vanishing under sand that engulfs entire houses, their roofs just barely visible above the dunes.

title: S.N.L.: Dan Crenshaw Accepts Pete Davidsons Apology and Delivers Some Zingers
description: Pete Davidson apologized on Saturday Night Live this weekend to Dan Crenshaw, the former Navy SEAL and newly elected representative he mocked last week in a widely criticized Weekend Update segment. In a surprise cameo, Crenshaw appeared alongside Davidson to take a few humorous potshots of his own and then, more earnestly, to try to find some common ground.

title: How China Creates Cancer Refugees
description: A rural resident in China is 30 percent more likely to die after a cancer diagnosis than an urban resident. Three rural families trying to beat these odds  cancer refugees  share their stories of battling the disease far from home and the financial ruin it causes.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $600,000
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: California, Midterms, Armistice Day: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Hotels See Panic Buttons as a #MeToo Solution for Workers. Guest Bans? Not So Fast.
description: The hotel industry is betting that a simple device can help solve the complex problem of guests sexually assaulting and harassing workers.

title: Trumps Nationalism, Rebuked at World War I Ceremony, Is Reshaping Much of Europe
description: PARIS  Dozens of leaders from around the globe marched in the soaking rain down the Champs-lyses on Sunday, expressing solidarity for an international order that had its origins in the end of a world war 100 years ago, an order now under increasing pressure on both sides of the Atlantic.

title: Remembering the End of World War I, in Photos
description: Thousands of people around the world commemorated on Sunday the centenary of the armistice that ended World War I, the so-called Great War that left millions dead and reshaped European borders, international warfare and society.

title: New Director Expands MOCAs Board With Four Global Members
description: LOS ANGELES  In one of his first moves as director of the Museum of Contemporary Art, Klaus Biesenbach has expanded his board to include four new members: Adrian Cheng, Simon Mordant, Julia Stoschek and Marina Kellen French. The first three are board members of MoMA PS1, where Mr. Biesenbach had been director through late October.

title: A White House Challenge: Balancing the Roles of the First Lady and First Daughter
description: WASHINGTON  When Melania Trumps chief of staff announced at a staff meeting months ago that the first lady would be traveling to Africa for her first solo journey abroad, aides to Ivanka Trump, her stepdaughter, sent back a message: She was planning her own trip to Africa but just hadnt announced it yet.

title: Pompeo Faces a World of Challenges. Add House Democrats to the List.
description: WASHINGTON  In May, just weeks after becoming secretary of state, Mike Pompeo returned to Capitol Hill for defiant and surprisingly heated exchanges about diplomacy with his former Democratic colleagues.

title: Cheer, Cheer for Old Notre Dame All the Way in Staten Island
description: Peter Mulroy is loyal to the University of Notre Dames football team, which won one for the Gipper in the 1920s and is undefeated this season as it practices for Saturdays game against Syracuse University at Yankee Stadium.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Ill get to the cooking soon enough, to the soups and stir-fries, the pastas and bakes, a weeks worth of recipes, our usual Sunday brief. But were 10 days out from Thanksgiving, and Im the coach running vicious practices because I want you to win. There is stuff to do before we cook.

title: A Nonverbal Son and a Moms Life on Hold
description: At the deli downstairs, they know that Xavier Guzman likes his sausage grilled and wrapped, just the patties and nothing else.

title: Louvre Abu Dhabi Draws One Million People in Debut Year
description: A year since its opening, the Louvre Abu Dhabi drew more than a million visitors to its dome-shaped museum that features borrowed treasures by Leonardo da Vinci and Vincent van Gogh from the collections of French institutions.

title: In the Campaign, Democrats Didnt Let Trump Distract Them. That Will Be Harder Now.
description: WASHINGTON  Two days after midterm congressional elections that handed them control of the House, triumphant Democrats dialed in to their first conference call since winning the majority to strategize on the way forward.

title: Alibabas Singles Day Sales Top $30 Billion. The Party May Not Last.
description: SHANGHAI  After 24 hours of frenzied buying and selling, and weeks of advertising and promotions before it, the Alibaba Group announced that its sales hit another titanic high on Singles Day, the Nov. 11 shopping festival that the Chinese e-commerce behemoth cooked up a decade ago.

title: Young Activists Go Missing in China, Raising Fears of Crackdown
description: BEIJING  At least a dozen young activists who took part in a national campaign for workers rights in China are missing, friends said on Sunday, in what appeared to be an effort by the government to silence one of the most visible student protests in years.

title: Oskar Rabin, Defiant Artist During Soviet Era, Dies at 90
description: Oskar Rabin, a painter who was at the center of a group of dissident artists who defied the Soviet authorities in the 1960s and 70s, died on Wednesday in Florence, Italy. He was 90.

title: Iranians Fear Medicine Shortages as U.S. Tightens Sanctions
description: The strain was evident in Alireza Karimis voice as he described his struggle to obtain the diazoxide pills his father needs to lower insulin levels and fight pancreatic cancer.

title: Too Much Screen Time for Kids?

description: To the Editor:

title: What We Learned in N.F.L. Week 10
description: It was not expected to be much of a week, with oddsmakers declaring nearly every game a mismatch and only two games scheduled between teams with winning records. But Tennessee had a huge upset of New England, the Buffalo Bills crushed the Jets, and the Cleveland Browns won a third game in a season for the first time since 2015. It wasnt all pretty, but plenty of fun was had. Heres what we learned.

title: Saudis Close to Crown Prince Discussed Killing Other Enemies a Year Before Khashoggis Death
description: WASHINGTON  Top Saudi intelligence officials close to Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman asked a small group of businessmen last year about using private companies to assassinate Iranian enemies of the kingdom, according to three people familiar with the discussions.

title: Advice for the Democrats After the Midterms
description: To the Editor:

title: Top Democrats Vow to Block Matthew Whitaker From Interfering in Russia Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  Top congressional Democrats demanded on Sunday that President Trumps acting attorney general, Matthew Whitaker, recuse himself from overseeing the special counsel investigation, and vowed to use their newfound powers as the incoming House majority to block him from interfering with it.

title: Frances Mayors, Feeling the Pinch, Lead a Quiet Rebellion and Quit
description: SAINT-SEINE-SUR-VINGEANNE, France  As mayor of this postage-stamp village deep in Burgundy, France, Louis Gentilhomme presided over a small but seemingly idyllic patch. The loudest noise on a recent day was the autumn breeze whistling in the trees. There were a few streets of stone houses, a 13th-century church, one baker and not much else.

title: In China, Desperate Patients Smuggle Drugs. Or Make Their Own.
description: JINZHOU, China Zhang Zhejun used a fat plastic straw to gently tap the pale yellow pharmaceutical powder onto a piece of silver foil that lay on an electronic scale. He made sure the amount was just right before he poured it into a clear capsule.

title: California Fires Map: Tracking the Spread
description: Wildfires have burned in California near the Sierra Nevada foothills and the Los Angeles shoreline, engulfing nearly 250,000 acres.

title: Borrowers Face Hazy Path as Program to Forgive Student Loans Stalls Under Betsy DeVos
description: The students attended institutions with pragmatic names like the Minnesota School of Business and others whose branding evoked ivy-draped buildings and leafy quads, like Corinthian Colleges. Tens of thousands of them say they are alike in one respect: They were victims of fraud, left with useless degrees and crushing debts.

title: The Grinch Rakes in the Green at the Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  The Grinch, 61 years old, may be as cuddly as a cactus and as charming as an eel, to quote his creator. But slather him with high-fructose corn syrup (perky computer animation), roll him in a mega-marketing campaign (10 million Grinch-themed boxes shipped by Amazon alone), and the green critter is as sure a bet as there is in mass holiday entertainment.

title: In a Netherlands Museum Director, the Nazis Found an Ally
description: ROTTERDAM, the Netherlands  In 1943, an official of an art clearing house the Nazis set up in the Netherlands to sell looted Jewish property, approached the director of the Boijmans Museum in Rotterdam. He had four works he wanted to sell, including a lovely oil painting, Woman Seated on the Grass at the Edge of a Meadow and Reading, by Nicolaas van der Waay.

title: How a Former Canadian Spy Helps Wall Street Mavens Think Smarter
description: Shane Parrish was a cybersecurity expert at Canadas top intelligence agency and an occasional blogger when he noticed something curious about his modest readership six years ago: 80 percent of his followers worked on Wall Street.

title: California Fires, D.I.Y. Drugs, Alibaba: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: Calling Glenn Puts a Humorous Spin on Gaga Dancing
description: Since 2013, when the Israeli-born choreographer Danielle Agami moved to Los Angeles, she has been making a name for herself there, winning awards with and without her company, Ate9. New Yorkers dont have many chances to check out her work, but one came on Saturday, when her troupe performed at the Schimmel Center. And the piece, Calling Glenn, alludes in its title to an additional attraction: Glenn Kotche, the drummer for the rock band Wilco.

title: Louise DeSalvo, Memoirist and Virginia Woolf Scholar, Dies at 76
description: Louise A. DeSalvo, a Virginia Woolf scholar and memoirist who mined her Italian-American heritage for her books and who once observed that life is too short for even one bad meal, died on Oct. 31 in Montclair, N.J. She was 76.

title: He Befriended 4,000 Dogs to Get Their Side of the Story
description: Dogs in New York City have a miserable life  thats what Ken Foster kept hearing. How could they not? Many live in tiny apartments. Most do not have backyards to romp around in. They are bored at home all day while their owners toil long hours.

title: What Happens When Fluxus Enters the Concert Hall?
description: LOS ANGELES  Fluxus is fraught with contradiction. The interdisciplinary art movement, which emerged in the 1960s, is funny but serious; indefinite but authoritative; destructive but full of possibility.

title: Are You Ready for the Nanoinfluencers?
description: By now you have probably heard of influencers, that group of internet-famous people who have more than a million social media followers and can make big money by plugging various brands. And you may have even heard of microinfluencers, who do the same thing for a still sizable but somewhat smaller social media audience  from the tens to low hundreds of thousands.

title: Polands Leaders March With Far-Right Groups on Independence Day
description: WARSAW  It was meant to foster unity and celebrate the sacrifices of past generations in the creation of the modern Polish nation. But after days of wrangling and controversy, the countrys Independence Day celebration on Sunday ended up highlighting Polands deep divisions.

title: How to Help California Fire Victims
description: Three wildfires in California have displaced hundreds of thousands of people and destroyed thousands of homes. So far, dozens of people have been confirmed dead and hundreds more are missing.

title: Jay O. Sanders on How an Oak Tree Became Uncle Vanya
description: Jay O. Sanders is, by his own definition, an oak tree  an imposing physical type associated with sturdiness, reliability and, on occasion, menace. And because Mr. Sanders has been a much-employed actor on stage and screen for some 40 years, he knows that oaks are rarely cast as the neurotic and cerebral title character of Chekhovs Uncle Vanya.

title: Manchester City Surges Past United, and to a Higher Level
description: MANCHESTER, England  Leroy San took a touch, and flicked the ball to Raheem Sterling. Ashley Young, the Manchester United captain, tracked the pass. Sterling controlled the ball and slipped it back to San. Young shuttled back the way he came. San waited until he arrived, and then rolled the ball to Phil Foden. Young set off again. Foden back to San, San to Sterling, around and around, again and again, hypnotic and unstoppable and relentless.

title: OPEC, Russia Weigh Production Cuts to Prop Up Oil Prices
description: Major oil producers meeting in Abu Dhabi on Sunday signaled that they were considering once again changing course and cutting production.

title: Jailbreaks, Submarines, a Gold-Plated AK-47: El Chapos Trial Will Tell an Epic Tale
description: Even as the Mexican police jet started its descent into Long Island, Joaqun Guzmn Loera had no idea where he was going. All he knew was that hours earlier, he had been whisked from a prison in Ciudad Jurez and put aboard the plane.

title: Show Up for Negotiations
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  We begin our solving week by welcoming a new constructor named Kathy Bloomer, who is calling this meeting to order.

title: Should the Press Boycott Trump? Political Strategists Weigh In
description: The CNN chief Jeff Zucker gave his troops unexpected orders the day after President Trump snatched the press credential away from Jim Acosta, one of the networks White House correspondents.

title: Canadas Message to Teenagers: Marijuana Is Legal Now. Please Dont Smoke It.
description: THORNBURY, Ontario  Parents and grandparents jammed the small hall of Thornbury, a sleepy ski town north of Toronto, to glean tips on how to talk to their teenagers about the potential harms of marijuana.

title: Forced Out by Deadly Fires, Then Trapped in Traffic
description: For the latest on the California fires, read our Monday live updates here.

title: See How New York Celebrated Veterans Day
description: For Chris Lotspeich, Veterans Day is a family affair.

title: Scholar Who Escaped Nazis Dies After a Push by a Subway Rider in a Rush
description: Among the thousands of commuters traveling through Pennsylvania Station late last month was Kurt Salzinger, a native of Austria who fled the country as the Nazis marched in. He distinguished himself years later in the United States as a scholar in the field of behavioral psychology.

title: Not Down for the Count on China?
description: Despite Mr. Trump's beating in last weeks midterm elections, President Xi Xinping may not want to breathe a sigh of relief just yet, as the sanctions against China are seen by many as having broad support, perhaps even among the soon-to-be bluer U.S. House of Representatives.

title: How to Rake Leaves on a Windy Day
description: NASHVILLE  Leaf blowers are like giant whining insects that have moved into your skull. They are swarming just behind your eyes, drilling deep inside your teeth. Leaf blowers have ruined autumn with their insistent whine and their noxious fumes, and they are everywhere. You may believe it is futile to resist them, but you still can. In almost every situation where something is loud, obnoxious and seemingly ubiquitous, resistance is an option.

title: E! Peoples Choice Awards Red Carpet
description: Theres only one awards show that celebrates not only musicians and actors but also game changers, social celebrities, animal stars and beauty influencers, all on one stage: The E! Peoples Choice Awards. Formerly hosted on CBS, this year the awards have a new network and no host. Votes came in across platforms like Snapchat, Instagram and Facebook, and categories have been expanded to include best T.V. show revival and best concert tour.

title: Now Serving Pie. And Only Pie.
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.

title: Let the People Vote
description: The United States finally has the pro-democracy movement that it needs.

title: Remembering the Forgotten War
description: SANTA FE, N.M.  Although more than 1.8 million Americans served in the Korean War  and more than 33,000 were killed in action  it is still our Forgotten War, a kind of also-ran in our historical consciousness.

title: Deadly Gaza Raid by Israel Threatens Nascent Cease-Fire
description: JERUSALEM  A covert Israeli operation in the Gaza Strip apparently went bad on Sunday, leaving at least seven Palestinians dead, including one senior Hamas military commander, and puncturing a nascent cease-fire with a flurry of airstrikes and rocket fire.

title: You Have a Right to Weariness
description: Do we have a right to weariness in an era of animus? More precisely, can we afford it, or is exhaustion a luxury reserved for those whose wealth, privilege and status insulate them from the losses the rest of us could suffer? Does patriotic defense of country require perpetual, obsessive vigilance, or is it permissible to retreat occasionally for ones own mental and spiritual health?

title: Parishioners Gather to Support Bronx Bishop Accused of Sexual Abuse
description: On Friday evening, inside Our Lady of Refuge church in the Bronx, a man tapped on his phone and then raised it high, so each of the approximately 250 people in attendance could see the screen.

title: Uncounted Ballots, Overvoted Ballots: Why Is the Governor Claiming Fraud in Floridas Election?
description: LAUDERHILL, Fla.  In the chaos that has swirled over the vote count in Florida following Tuesdays midterm elections, one headline made its way ominously around the state: A teacher in Broward County had discovered a box labeled provisional ballots, left behind at the polling place at her school.

title: E! Peoples Choice Red Carpet
description: For the first time E! took over the Peoples Choice Awards. Here are photos from the red carpet.

title: Outlander Season 4, Episode 2 Recap: Southern Hospitality
description: Last time Outlander engaged the subject of slavery, Claire and Jamie bought a person. (They promised to free him  and did, although Temeraires patent disbelief was that subplots best note.) But he existed largely as a plot point, and the slave auction scene was more concerned with how Claire felt than with the slaves. The white-savior framework felt like a way for the show to acknowledge slavery without making Jamie and Claire tackle it head on.

title: Review: Michael C. Hall Probes the Despair of Thom Pain
description: The dark and sulfurous chamber of Thom Pains mind has been unsealed for public inspection again. Audiences already familiar with Will Enos Thom Pain (based on nothing), which has been revived by the Signature Theater, may find this Stygian space roomier and less oppressive than they remembered.

title: Review: Mike Birbiglia Is a Very Nervous Dad in The New One
description: If Mike Birbiglia were a piece of furniture, he would surely be a well-worn, deeply stained, slightly squishy couch, much like the one he describes at the beginning of The New One, his winning Broadway debut at the Cort Theater. That may not sound like a flattering comparison.

title: Quotation of the Day: In the Campaign, Democrats Didnt Let Trump Distract Them. That Will Be Harder Now.
description: These Democrats didnt get elected, by and large, to war with Trump. They got elected to try and get some positive things done on issues like health care and economic issues.

title: Corrections: November 12, 2018
description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, November 12, 2018.

title: Australian Woman Accused of Spiking Strawberries With Needles
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The Queensland police have arrested a former strawberry industry worker for spiking strawberries with needles, a crime that fueled a nationwide scare that crippled Australias strawberry industry.

title: This Town Once Feared the 10-Story Waves. Then the Extreme Surfers Showed Up.
description: NAZAR, Portugal  At the market in the ancient fishing village of Nazar, Portuguese pensioners shopped for their fruit and vegetables. Retired fishermen chatted over coffee. And a record-breaking American surfer sipped on a cucumber and celery smoothie.

title: Saudi Arabia Is Misusing Mecca
description: The rulers of Saudi Arabia derive much of their legitimacy and prestige in the Muslim world from their control and upkeep of the Grand Mosque and the Kaaba in Mecca and the mosque of Prophet Muhammad in Medina. King Salman, like the rulers before him, wears the title of the Khadim al-aramayn al-Sharifayn, which is translated as the Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques or, more precisely, The Servant of the Two Noble Sanctuaries.

title: On Politics: Democrats Contemplate Their House Majority
description: Good Monday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

title: U.S.-China relations are bound to change
description: The economic relationship between the U.S. and China will still be existential and essential, but there will be a large underlying shift that will bring about a different price point, different equilibrium, different terms. Marginal shifts will come about as a function of the continuing trade talks but we need to be cognizant of the more fundamental shift in the relationship.

title: Word + Quiz: affable

description: Information may want to be free, as an aphorism had it in the early days of digital media. But these days, increasingly, journalism wants to be paid for.

title: They Were Stopped at the Texas Border. Their Nightmare Had Only Just Begun.
description: MCALLEN, Tex.  The Border Patrol agent, she remembers, was calm when he tied her to the tree and put silver duct tape over her mouth. He said very little.

title: Blockchain will create more wealth
description: Joseph Lubin thinks that blockchain technology will push us from a scarcity mindset to an abundance mindset, allowing us to be in greater control of our own identity and agency and in turn creating more wealth.

title: Luxury is a global game
description: Will the geographical origin of a luxury brand become less important in this global age? Thierry Andretta says that luxury has always been a global concept, and that brands need to play a global game to appeal to its customers.

title: In North Korea, Missile Bases Suggest a Great Deception
description: WASHINGTON  North Korea is moving ahead with its ballistic missile program at 16 hidden bases that have been identified in new commercial satellite images, a network long known to American intelligence agencies but left undiscussed as President Trump claims to have neutralized the Norths nuclear threat.

title: The importance of brand protection
description: Alibaba must be a global leader in brand protection. Protecting brands and rooting out counterfeits is good for consumers, and good for Alibaba itself.

title: Coming to Papua New Guinea: World Leaders (and 40 Maseratis)
description: PORT MORESBY, Papua New Guinea  The Maseratis and Bentleys have been delivered. Laborers from China have repaired roads and installed bus stop shelters with signs saying China Aid. Three cruise ships will serve as temporary hotels.

title: Who Is Your Favorite Visual Artist? What Is Your Favorite Work of Art?
description: Do you have a favorite work of art? Who created it? Is that person your favorite visual artist? If not, who is?

title: Something Happened to U.S. Drug Costs in the 1990s
description: There was a time when America approximated other wealthy countries in drug spending. But in the late 1990s, U.S. spending took off. It tripled between 1997 and 2007, according to a study in Health Affairs.

title: Too Much Caffeine May Stress the Heart
description: As my brother neared the end of a smooth, swift recovery from open-heart surgery to bypass an 80-percent blockage in his hearts most important artery recently, he reverted to a longstanding habit of downing many cups a day of strong coffee. I objected, but he insisted that the caffeine doesnt affect him, meaning it doesnt disturb his sleep.

title: The War to End All Measles
description: Armistice Day was first celebrated in 1919, a year after the armistice that ended the long and terrible first World War, taking effect at precisely 11:11 a.m. on Nov. 11. It was renamed Veterans Day in 1954, to honor all those who had served, but also perhaps to acknowledge that the war to end all wars had done no such thing.

title: Applications Open for the 2019 New York Portfolio Review
description: It takes time, passion and obsession to make great work. But you also need the opportunity to have your work seen in the first place. And since we at Lens believe only the quality of work should matter  not your connections or bank account  we are again bringing together 160 talented photographers with 75 top photo editors, publishers, curators, gallery owners and video producers, for the 7th annual New York Portfolio Review on March 30 and 31 in New York City.

title: Trumps Nafta Plan Could Be Upended by Democrats House Takeover
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps promise to quickly pass a revamped North American Free Trade Agreement has been upended by the midterm elections, with Democrats who will soon control the House vowing to withhold their support to extract greater protections for American workers.

title: The Wheels on These Buses Go Round and Round With Zero Emissions
description: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y. Some of the kids call it the singing bus, said Juliessa Diclo Cruz, 10, as she rode in back of one of New York States first-ever electric school buses on a chilly October morning.

title: In Brazil, Animals Cross a Road of No Return
description: Whenever Wagner Fischer drives, he notices the roadkill.

description: In March 1990, L. Ling-chi Wang got on a plane to Washington, where he felt that his words were being twisted.

title: Finding a Mom Network in Battery Park City
description: When Aisling McDonagh became pregnant with her daughter three years ago, she was living in Independence Plaza, a three-tower complex in TriBeCa.

title: American Jews Face a Choice: Create Meaning or Fade Away
description: When a gunman slaughtered 11 worshipers in a Pittsburgh synagogue on a Shabbat morning last month, American Jews were left with a jumble of intense emotions: horror and fear, certainly, but also an old embattled feeling, centuries in the making. They were victims, in America, a country that has never seen even a hint of a pogrom. In their pain and worry, individual Jews had a rare chance to feel themselves part of a larger community  one that mourns together, gets angry together, imbued with a separate and unique identity, threatened yet resilient. And in this, victimhood offered an illusion.

title: With Petrino Debacle, Not Being a Judge of Character Bites Louisville Again
description: Less than a year ago, Bobby Petrino was in a New York City ballroom waiting to see if his quarterback, Lamar Jackson, would win the Heisman Trophy. Jackson came in third, but that was O.K.: He had won it the year before, the first Louisville player to do so.

description: First, it came for eyeglasses. And then it came for makeup. It came for mattresses, and razors and erectile dysfunction pills. And now, finally, the Great Disruption has come for your cookware.

title: Where Will Science Take Us? To the Stars
description: After 30 hours of bumping along on planes and buses, at long last I stood in the darkness and gazed upon an immense night sky. My long journey seemingly had brought me to the shoreline of interstellar space rather than the high-altitude plateau that is Chiles Atacama Desert.

title: Can a Fired Transgender Worker Sue for Job Discrimination?
description: WASHINGTON  In 2013, a funeral director who had been known as Anthony Stephens wrote to colleagues at a Michigan funeral home, asking for patience and support.

title: U.S. Navy Carrier Suffers Second Aircraft Crash in Weeks
description: BEIJING  A United States Navy warplane crashed into the sea northeast of the Philippines on Monday, the second crash in less than a month involving aircraft from the carrier the U.S.S. Ronald Reagan.

title: Taliban Slaughter Elite Afghan Troops, and a Safe District Is Falling
description: SANG-E-MASHA, Afghanistan  One pickup truck after another arrived at the government compound in a district capital in Afghanistan on Sunday, pulling around to the back of the governors office to unload the dead, out of sight of panicked residents.

title: Do the Math. Moderate Democrats Will Not Win in 2020.
description: Andrew Gillum and Stacey Abrams, progressive African-American Democratic candidates, may not have won their races for governor in Florida and Georgia (both are still too close to call). But the strategy they followed is still the best strategy for Democrats to win: inspiring, mobilizing and turning out voters of color and progressive whites.

title: Meet the New House Democrats: They May Not Toe the Party Line

There are two former C.I.A. officials, an Air Force veteran, a former Navy helicopter pilot, and a retired Marine commander  all of them women. Not to mention a pediatrician and a human rights advocate.

title: The Dallas Cowboys: Striving for Mediocrity in a Topsy-Turvy World
description: PHILADELPHIA  Jerry Jones strode into the Dallas Cowboys locker room a few minutes before midnight Sunday. Woooooo! Jones bellowed,  la the wrestler Ric Flair, as he moved from player to player, pumping hands, offering hugs, dispensing congratulations after a 27-20 triumph against the Eagles that, he said, thrust his team into N.F.C. East contention.

title: Make online shopping a luxury
description: Now, after holding back for so long, is the time for the luxury industry to jump into online shopping, says Ian Rogers, chief digital officer of LVMH. But the focus should be on making online shopping a luxury, with customer experiences, not technical capabilities, as the main priority.

description: While online shopping will become ever more prevalent, brand-building will still be fundamentally an offline, physical experience, says Scott Malkin, founder and chairman of Value Retail P.L.C.

description: BEIJING  The Chinese government, bowing to pressure from environmental groups, said on Monday that it would temporarily reinstate a ban on the use of rhinoceros horns and tiger bones in medicine.

title: Stimulus Plan or Populist Giveaway? Italys Budget Sets Up Clash With E.U.
description: NAPLES, Italy  Italys desperate need for a financial shot in the arm is palpable at all levels of the economy, from the entrepreneurs in the industrial north who are hungry for tax breaks and a streamlined bureaucracy to the welfare seekers in the poverty-stricken south, with its dizzying levels of youth unemployment.

title: Broadways Next Evan Hansen? A 16-Year-Old High School Junior
description: Andrew Barth Feldman has been keeping a list of people hell need to call when the news comes out: that he, a 16-year-old high school junior, will be making his Broadway debut this winter as the title character in Dear Evan Hansen.

title: Five More Museums Acquire Art From Souls Grown Deep Foundation
description: In a strategic effort to reshape the narrative of American art, the Souls Grown Deep Foundation will help five museums acquire paintings, sculptures and works on paper by self-taught African-American artists of the South. These acquisitions bring to 12 the number of museums that have received more than 300 works from the Atlanta-based nonprofit, through gifts and purchase.

title: Alone in New York, She Needed a Mattress
description: When she was 13, Nazi bombs dropped on Yana Gilchenoks house in the Gorodok ghetto of Belarus, driving her, along with her mother, sister and niece, to seek shelter with other families in a nearby forest.

title: Before the Fights Over Recounts: An Election Day Vote on Voting
description: Amid the recounts, recriminations and allegations of voter suppression or ballot fraud, something else happened in Tuesdays elections  a wave of actions aimed at making voting easier and fairer that is an often-overlooked strain in the nations voting wars.

title: What to Cook Right Now
description: Good morning. I was in Portland, Ore., over the weekend, eating great food (at Han Oak and Kachinka, if you're wondering). The visit was a chance to talk to the chef Edward Lee about his book Buttermilk Graffiti at the Portland Book Festival. There was no cooking for me.

title: Toy Story 4 Trailer: Introducing Forky
description: More than 20 years after the original Toy Story, the toys are back in town with a teaser for the fourth installment of the smash animated franchise. Favorites like Woody (voiced by Tom Hanks), Buzz Lightyear (Tim Allen) and Jessie (Joan Cusack) frolic in a circle to Judy Collinss cover of Joni Mitchells Both Sides Now until a newcomer wreaks havoc. That would be Forky.

title: Tim Daly, Sibling Bonds and the Stage
description: In 1979, Tim Daly was playing a Russian soldier outfitted with an imposing black wool hat in Shaws Arms and the Man in Palm Beach, Fla., when his older sister Tyne, who was performing nearby at the Burt Reynolds Dinner Theater, dropped by on closing night.

title: Cost of Botched Gaza Spy Mission? Israels Back on Brink of War
description: JERUSALEM  On Sunday, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu assured Israelis weary of conflict with Palestinians in the Gaza Strip that he was doing everything I can in order to avoid an unnecessary war.

title: Its Time to Make Video Games Safe for Children
description: Imagine that your daughter is playing Fortnite, and a troll in another country joins the game and begins sexually harassing her. Imagine that your son is watching his favorite video gamer live-stream an eSports game, and the streamer begins to shout obscenities.

title: Tales From the Warhol Factory
description: Concealed behind the pasty mask, the trademark fright wig and the impassive expression Andy Warhol showed to the world was a man of roiling complexities. Depending on who does the talking, Warhol was either an emotional vampire draining vital juices from the animated nut-jobs he gathered to him or a kindly, if slightly creepy, avuncular figure whose motives have been misunderstood.

title: How to Reduce the Risk of the Scary Thing You Want to Do
description: You shouldnt start a restaurant unless you know people like your cooking.

title: What the Heck Is That?
description: Many animals appear in the New York Times Crossword, but the ring-tailed COATI, a relative of the raccoon, seems to go relatively unrecognized by solvers.

title: The Gun-Safety Issue Is Actually Helping Democrats
description: It is an unsettling coincidence that mass shootings bookended the 2018 election, from a Pittsburgh synagogue on Oct. 27 to a bar in Thousand Oaks, Calif., on Nov. 7. The election that took place in between, though, demonstrated that Democrats and even some Republicans found gun-safety advocacy a boon to their campaigns in a way not seen in a long time. In comparison with previous elections, the gun-rights forces customary blaring megaphone seemed nowhere near as loud as usual  or as effective. This is borne out by an examination of public attitudes, candidate positions, money and exposure.

title: Wildfire Becomes Deadliest in California History
description: PARADISE, Calif.  [For the latest updates on the California wildfires, read our Tuesday live briefing here]

title: Touch Not the Cat
description: A. The biggest threat to the Scottish wildcat, Felis silvestris, is widespread interbreeding with feral domestic cats. The wildcats are endangered; just 45 to 100 purebred specimens remain, mostly roaming remote parts of Scotlands western Highlands.

title: Does Calgary Really Want the Winter Olympics? Does Anyone?
description: CALGARY, Alberta  Hobbled by a reputation for gross expense and corruption, the International Olympic Committee has become a mendicant, shuffling from nation to nation, shaking its cup and asking if anyone might be interested in bidding on the 2026 Winter Games.

title: Meet the KGB Spies Who Invented Fake News
description: We reveal how one of the biggest fake news stories ever concocted  the 1984 AIDS-is-a-biological-weapon hoax  went viral in the pre-Internet era. Meet the KGB cons who invented it, and the truth squad that quashed it. For a bit.

title: Like a Diamond in the Sky: The Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree Has a New Glow
description: Daniel Libeskind, the world-renowned master-plan architect for the reconstruction of the World Trade Center, first saw the Rockefeller Center Christmas tree as a teenager, in 1961, shortly after he had moved to New York from Poland  though the star was not at all memorable.

title: The Story of America, Told Through Mark Twains Favorite Foods
description: HARTFORD  Mark Twain was a well-traveled literary superstar, so famous that his editor once journeyed to Washington to ask President Theodore Roosevelt if he would move Thanksgiving because it coincided with Twains birthday plans. (Twain moved his party.)

title: Have You Had to Flee the California Wildfires? We Want to Hear From You
description: Three major fires are ravaging California, killing dozens, destroying thousands of homes and forcing families to leave almost everything behind and evacuate.

title: Merkel Antagonist Quits Party Post but Stays On as Interior Minister
description: BERLIN  Horst Seehofer, the defiant German interior minister whose provocations have undermined Chancellor Angela Merkels government and eroded support for his own conservative party, said Monday that he would step down as head of the Christian Social Union, a key part of Ms. Merkels governing coalition.

title: Portrait of a Marriage, Onstage and at the Barricades
description: In a 1995 joint profile in The New York Times, the actors and activists Ruby Dee and Ossie Davis were described  as being without peer in an industry not known for nurturing black people, older people or long marriages.

title: The Rise and Fall of Turkey Brining
description: Dear Thanksgiving cooks of America: On behalf of food writers everywhere, I apologize.

title: How A Chorus Line Veterans Pass It on to a New Generation
description: In rehearsals for A Chorus Line, it can be difficult to tell where practice ends and the show begins.

title: Japanese Theater Inspires a New Opera of Celestial Textures
description: The Noh is unquestionably one of the great arts of the world, the poet Ezra Pound wrote in 1916, and it is quite possibly one of the most recondite.

title: A Detective Pikachu Trailer and More: 6 Things in Pop Culture Today
description: What would you like to see here? Email us at popculture@nytimes.com.

title: Stocks Dive After Apple Supplier Slashes Outlook
description: Stocks dropped on Monday, giving back a slice of their recent gains as investors dumped shares in some of the large technology companies that hold outsize sway over major market indexes.

title: Neil deGrasse Tyson Explores the Symbiosis Between War and Astrophysics
description: ACCESSORY TO WAR The Unspoken Alliance Between Astrophysics and the Military By Neil deGrasse Tyson and Avis Lang Read by Neil deGrasse Tyson and Courtney B. Vance18 hours, 38 minutes. Random House Audio.

title: Stan Lee
description: Stan Lee was for many the embodiment of Marvel Comics, if not comic books in general.

title: Stan Lee Is Dead at 95; Superhero of Marvel Comics
description: If Stan Lee revolutionized the comic book world in the 1960s, which he did, he left as big a stamp  maybe bigger  on the even wider pop culture landscape of today.

title: North Korea, China, Afghanistan: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: An Unlikely Relationship With Guns
description: When the African-American journalist RJ Young first met Charles Stafford, the white Oklahoman man who would become his father-in-law for a time, Stafford walked out of the room, came back and handed Young a very large revolver. I felt certain, Young writes, that I had landed in either Wes Cravens rendition of Guess Whos Coming to Dinner or the next film in the Saw franchise.

title: Streaming Carries Metro Boomin to a No. 1 Album and Ariana Grande to a No. 1 Single
description: The producer Metro Boomin has helped define the sound of rap in recent years and now, as a behind-the-scenes figure, he has something rare to show for it: a No. 1 album as a lead artist.

title: U.S. Bishops Had a Plan to Curb Sex Abuse. Rome Ordered Them to Wait.
description: BALTIMORE  Facing a reignited crisis of credibility over child sexual abuse, the Roman Catholic bishops of the United States came to a meeting in Baltimore on Monday prepared to show that they could hold themselves accountable.

title: In Michigan, the Best Candidates Just Happened to Be Women
description: The first time I ran for office, for a seat on my county board of commissioners, I was 24 years old. I didnt have a lot of political experience. What I did have was a cause I believed in  keeping the local nursing home open  and the willingness to work really hard. My opponent in the race, an older male incumbent, derisively referred to me as that young broad. That young broad beat him.

title: Were Suing the Florida Governor. He Should Not Oversee His Own Election.
description: On Sunday, the Republican secretary of state of Arizona, Michele Reagan, did a stunning thing. She explained to America why it was taking so long to count the ballots in Arizonas unresolved Senate race. Her explanation was thorough, sober, informative and nonpartisan. Most important, it helped foster confidence in the process. It wasnt just her. Arizonas Republican governor, Doug Ducey, tweeted over the weekend: Lets get this right. All legally cast votes must be counted.

title: Mississippi Senators Public Hanging Remark Draws Backlash Before Runoff
description: With her arm around a cattle rancher, Senator Cindy Hyde-Smith, Republican of Mississippi, drew laughter and applause at a recent campaign event when she gushed about how highly she thought of him: If he invited me to a public hanging, Id be on the front row.

title: In Florida Election Standoff, Judge Urges Parties to Ramp Down the Rhetoric
description: LAUDERHILL, Fla.  For nearly a week, the parking lot behind the Broward County elections office has been the scene of an unfolding postelection drama, with protesters demanding the arrest of the local elections supervisor and politicians claiming fraud in the ballot-counting process. Gov. Rick Scott has fueled the fury, sending his lawyers to court in a bid to call in the police to prevent any possible tampering with ballot-counting machines.

title: Send Home a Danny Meyer Pie for Thanksgiving
description: The question for Thanksgiving is not whether to have pie, its simply what kind. This year, for the first time, Goldbelly will ship nationwide fresh-baked holiday beauties from several Danny Meyer restaurants in New York. (Mr. Meyers Enlightened Hospitality Investments recently led a $20 million investment in Goldbelly.) Sweet potato pie ($49) from Blue Smoke, apple crostata ($65) from Caffe Marchio, apple-crumb caramel ($69) and amaro-pecan ($69) from Maialino, chocolate-bourbon-pecan ($74) from Daily Provisions, and chocolate-hazelnut cream ($79) from Gramercy Tavern may be ordered through Sunday for next-day delivery (included) by Wednesday or whatever day you specify.

title: All-You-Can-Slurp Canadian Oysters
description: Canada is the source of many lip-smacking, cold-water oysters, including the flat Malpeque and one of my favorites, BeauSoleil, from New Brunswick. Docks Oyster Bar is gathering these and more than a dozen others, from the east and west coasts of Canada, to open and serve at an oyster festival on Saturday. The admission ticket includes unlimited oysters, chowders, other seafood, Canadian wines and beers, music and an oyster-shucking contest.

title: In the Race to Catch a Flight, Smoothing a Big Bump: The Rental-Car Return
description: Perry Morgan, a sales representative from Ocala, Fla., said the part of a recent business trip to Oakland, Calif., he dreaded most was lugging four heavy suitcases on a shuttle bus back and forth from the airport terminal to the car rental center.

title: A Time Capsule for Scientists, Courtesy of Peter the Great
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia  Standing alone, a few minutes before the doors were to open at the Zoological Museum of the Zoological Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Alexei Tikhonov gazed at Masha, a 30,000-year-old baby mammoth that he brought here from a Siberian riverbank thirty years ago.

title: Slim Volumes With Scores of Cocktail Ideas
description: A collection of 100 cocktail recipes  grouped in booklets according to the dominant spirit (amaro, Champagne, gin, rum, sherry, tequila and mezcal, whiskey and vodka) then boxed together  makes for a cunning reference tool or gift. About a dozen drinks, classics and others from bars around the country, are included in each tiny volume.

title: Three Things to Watch This Week
description: Every Monday, the Times TV critic Margaret Lyons picks the best of whats ahead before the weekend. Check back each week for more recommendations.

title: The Last Word: Stan Lee
description: Stan Lee, one of the most influential writers and publishers in the comic book industry, sat down with The New York Times in 2015 to talk about his life and career.

title: A Cheese Slate in a New York State of Mind
description: A new line of slate and wood boards puts urban chauvinism on display. The skyline of one of eight American cities adorns each of these new boards and slates from JK Adams, a cutting-board company in Dorset, Vt. The boards are nifty serving pieces to use for charcuterie, hors doeuvres or cheese, or to give.

title: New Shop Boasts Three Walls of Free-Flowing Chocolate
description: Turin, a Northern Italian city known for chocolate confections, is home to Venchi, a 140-year-old company that has opened a shop in New York. (The chocolate maker has a store in the Woodbury Common outlet mall upstate and a franchise in Miami.) The Manhattan store offers an immersive experience: A wall of chocolate bars and bins of wrapped chocolate bonbons leads to the rear lounge, with three walls of flowing chocolate waterfalls (glass protects visitors from spatter). Warm chocolate-hazelnut sauce is dispensed at a counter near the entrance to embellish rich gelati, mostly in chocolate and nut flavors, made in house. Other counters and shelves are filled with stacks of chocolate and nut bark and boxed assortments ready for gift-giving. Coffee and chocolate-filled pastries are available daily starting at 8 a.m.

title: An Armistice Trip Marked by Controversy
description: To the Editor:

title: Looking for Sichuan Ingredients? A Nashville Company Delivers
description: Sichuan peppercorns, the dried seed pods of the prickly ash, are actually not a kind of pepper, but a spice that delivers tongue-tingling heat with a citrus accent. They have become quite widely available. The ones sold by the Mala Market, a new company in Nashville, are high-quality. Taylor Holliday, the owner, imports the spices directly from the source, so they are fresher than most. She also sells fragrant green Sichuan peppercorns, which deliver a shade less heat but more all-around flavor. A dozen more essentials for Sichuan cooking  like preserved vegetables, chile pods, chile oil, soy sauce, fermented black beans, Chinese vinegar and handmade chile bean paste  are also sold. The website posts recipes, including a terrific one for dry-fried green beans.

title: As California Burns, Trump Threatens to Withhold Aid
description: To the Editor:

title: Photo of More Than 60 Students Giving Apparent Nazi Salute Is Being Investigated
description: Police and school officials in a small town in Wisconsin are investigating a photograph taken last spring of about 60 male high school students, many of them making what appears to be a Nazi salute.

title: My Moments With Stan
Trumps Misleading Claims About Californias Fire Mismanagement
description: As Californians were fleeing the huge wildfires that have left both ends of the state ablaze, President Trump took to Twitter over the weekend, blaming the infernos on forest management and threatening to withhold federal payments from the state.

title: Tell Your Boss: Recording Is Seen to Link Saudi Crown Prince More Strongly to Khashoggi Killing
description: WASHINGTON  Shortly after the journalist Jamal Khashoggi was assassinated last month, a member of the kill team instructed a superior over the phone to tell your boss, believed to be Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia, that the operatives had carried out their mission, according to three people familiar with a recording of Mr. Khashoggis killing collected by Turkish intelligence.

title: Counting Every Vote
description: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. Im Lisa Lerer, your host.

title: Trump Makes a Baseless Claim About Massively Infected Ballots in Florida
description: For days, Mr. Trump has lobbed a series of misleading and baseless claims about the midterm election results in Florida. His latest missive about missing and forged ballots is no different.

title: Douglas Rain, 90, Shakespearean and Voice of Computer Named HAL, Dies
description: Douglas Rain, who performed for 32 seasons with the Stratford Festival in Ontario but was perhaps most famous for one faceless movie role  the voice of the HAL 9000 computer in Stanley Kubricks landmark 1968 film, 2001: A Space Odyssey  died on Sunday in St. Marys, Ontario. He was 90.

title: Herbert London, Conservative Savant and Social Critic, Dies at 79
description: Herbert London, a self-described New York liberal mugged by reality who was transformed into an eloquent and consistently conservative academic, social critic and political candidate, died on Saturday in Manhattan. He was 79.

title: California Wildfires, Elections, Nafta: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The brand as a platform for dialogue
description: While its important for brands to be in constant contact with its customers in order to keep pace with changing tastes and demands, the important thing is to build a platform where the brand and the customer can have a two-way dialogue, says John R. Hoke III of Nike. The goal, he says, is to have customers use the brand as a platform, rather than just a place to transact.

title: Amazons HQ2 Will Benefit From New York City. But What Does New York Get?
description: The innovation myth used to involve the back of a suburban garage or an office park in Silicon Valley. The tech industry was incubated not on the mean streets of the big city, but in sleepy hamlets like Murray Hill, N.J., and Mountain View, Calif.

title: In N.H.L. Concussion Settlement, Owners Win the Fight
description: A settlement announced Monday between the N.H.L. and several hundred retired hockey players who accused the league of hiding the dangers of repeated head hits did little to quell the emotional intensity surrounding the issue.

title: Truth and Virtue in the Age of Trump
description: Remember when freedom was just another word for nothing left to lose? These days its just another word for giving lots of money to Donald Trump.

title: The Struggle to Stay Human Amid the Fight
description: I watched Stanley Kubricks masterpiece Paths of Glory last weekend, prompted by all the World War I centenary tributes. Set in the trenches near the end of the war, its a movie about a man who tries to maintain his integrity and his faith in humanity amid the stupidity, futility, cruelty and cynicism of war. Its weirdly relevant today.

title: Clean Energy Is Surging, but Not Fast Enough to Solve Global Warming
description: WASHINGTON Over the next two decades, the worlds energy system will undergo a huge transformation. Wind and solar power are poised to become dominant sources of electricity. Chinas once-relentless appetite for coal is set to wane. The amount of oil we use to fuel our cars could peak and decline.

title: 100 Years Later and Nationalism Is Still Here
California Fire Death Toll Now at 44 With Discovery of 13 More Bodies
description: LOS ANGELES  As emergency workers picked through fire-ravaged communities in Northern California on Monday, they recovered 13 more bodies, turning the largest wildfire in the states history into its deadliest as well.

title: Trumps Tax Cut Was Supposed to Change Corporate Behavior. Heres What Happened.
description: The $1.5 trillion tax overhaul that President Trump signed into law late last year has already given the American economy a jolt, at least temporarily. It has fattened the paychecks of most American workers, padded the profits of large corporations and sped economic growth.

title: Shohei Ohtani and Ronald Acua Jr. Are Rookies of the Year
description: On the day he learned he would need reconstructive elbow surgery, temporarily halting his dynamic pitching career, the Los Angeles Angels Shohei Ohtani turned to his other extraordinary talent. That night in early September, against the Texas Rangers, Ohtani went 4 for 4 with two home runs.

title: Could Oysters Ease Trade Tensions With U.S.? European Leaders Hope So
description: BRUSSELS  The United States and Europe may one day put aside their differences on trade, eliminate tariffs on industrial goods and work together to rein in their common economic adversary, China.

title: The Worldwide War on Truth
description: Governments from Pakistan to Mexico to Washington are woefully unequipped to combat disinformation warfare. Eastern European countries living in Russias shadow can teach us how to start fighting back, but only if our politicians decide to stop profiting from these tactics and fight them instead.

title: The Seven Commandments of Fake News
description: The Pizzagate playbook: Same tactics, new technologies. How the seven rules of Soviet disinformation are being used to create todays fake news stories. Pizza anyone?

title: Operation Infektion: A three-part video series on Russian disinformation
description: WATCH: This is a three-part film series. Scroll down and click to play any episode.

title: U.S. Declines to Sign Declaration Discouraging Use of Cyberattacks
description: WASHINGTON  Reflecting reluctance by the Trump administration to limit its options for using offensive and defensive cyberweapons, the United States declined on Monday to sign a vaguely worded international call to protect civilians against cyberattacks and discourage digital meddling in elections.

title: Bipartisan Sentencing Overhaul Moves Forward, but Rests on Trump
description: WASHINGTON  A bipartisan group of senators has reached a tentative deal on the most substantial rewrite of the nations sentencing and prison laws in a generation, giving judges more latitude to sidestep mandatory minimum sentences and easing drug sentences that have incarcerated African-Americans at much higher rates than white offenders.

title: Kyrsten Sinema Declared Winner in Arizona Senate Race
description: PHOENIX  Representative Kyrsten Sinema, a Democrat and former social worker, scored a groundbreaking victory in the race for a Senate seat in Arizona, defeating her Republican opponent after waging a campaign in which she embraced solidly centrist positions.

title: Cooperating Witness in Mueller Inquiry Predicts His Own Indictment for Lying
description: WASHINGTON  Jerome Corsi, a conspiracy theorist and friend of the longtime Trump adviser Roger J. Stone Jr., said on Monday that his two-month-long cooperation with the special counsels office has broken down and he expects to be charged with lying to investigators or a federal grand jury.

title: Black Security Guard Responding to Shooting Is Killed by Police
description: A black security guard at a bar in the Chicago suburbs was killed by the police as he apparently tried to detain a man he believed to be involved in a shooting, the authorities said Monday.

title: Trump Dreams Up Another Immigrant Crisis
description: Public safety, national security and the rule of law are among the incantations the Trump administration likes to chant when rolling out one of its deliberately and pointlessly cruel immigration policies. It evidently hopes that repetition will somehow insulate its actions from public or judicial scrutiny.

title: Inside the Republican Strategy to Discredit the Florida Recount
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla.  The concerted effort by Republicans in Washington and Florida to discredit the states recount as illegitimate and potentially rife with fraud reflects a cold political calculation: Treat the recount as the next phase of a campaign to secure the partys majority and agenda in the Senate.

title: In Californias Fires, Fear for the Missing: I Loved Her. And I Dont Know if Ill Ever See Her Again.
description: PARADISE, Calif.  Has anyone heard from Billy? Susan? Betty?

title: Facebook Failed to Police How Its Partners Handled User Data
description: Facebook failed to closely monitor device makers after granting them access to the personal data of hundreds of millions of people, according to a previously unreported disclosure to Congress last month.

title: A Saudi Murder Becomes a Gift to Iran
description: The Trump administration is not ready to admit it, but its Middle East strategy is in deep trouble, now compounded by the murder of the dissident journalist Jamal Khashoggi at the Saudi consulate in Turkey last month. The administrations recent pressure on the Saudis to seek a truce in their war in Yemen is a clear signal of just how much the credibility of Saudi Arabia, which is at the heart of that strategy, has shrunk, perhaps even in President Trumps eyes.

title: Review: Going From Schlub to Slick in The Other Josh Cohen
description: One is beamish: a smooth, guitar-strumming cutup. The other is sweet but borderline pathetic.

title: David Pearson, Silver Fox of Stock Car Racing, Dies at 83
description: David Pearson, who was hailed as Nascars Silver Fox for his cunning behind the wheel, which propelled him to three top-series championships and acclaim as perhaps the most brilliant driver in the history of stock-car racing, died on Monday. He was 83.

title: Why Many People Visit Napa
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Another day, another debut, and today we welcome John Ciolfi to the New York Times constructor club. Your black and white club jacket is in the mail, Mr. Ciolfi.

title: Caris LeVert of Nets Sustains Gruesome Leg Injury, Moving Some to Tears
description: Nets forward Caris LeVert, who has overcome three foot operations to become one of the teams most promising players, sustained a gruesome right leg injury Monday night in a 120-113 road loss to the Minnesota Timberwolves.

title: Corrections: November 13, 2018
description: FRONT PAGE

title: WeChat is Chinas platform for luxury
description: Jos Neves, founder and C.E.O. of Farfetch, thinks that WeChat is the best platform for luxury in China.

title: Quotation of the Day: Taliban Slaughter Elite Afghan Troops, and a Safe District Is Falling
description: All they give us is promises, but what can we do with promises? Twenty from my family are dead.

title: Watching closely to catch trends
description: Companies need to constantly watch their consumers closely to catch the emergence of the latest trends, says Ravi Thakran, the group chairman overseeing South and Southeast Asia, Australia and the Middle East for LVMH. He pointed to the example of women hanging charms on their handbag, a trend that started in Asia but has since influenced the industry globally.

title: Federal Judge Delays Certification of Georgia Election Results
description: ATLANTA  A federal judge on Monday ordered a delay in the certification of Georgias election results, citing concerns about the states voter registration system and the handling of provisional ballots. The decision effectively deepened the turmoil in Georgias campaign for governor, a still unsettled contest that has been among the most acrimonious campaigns in the nation this year.

title: Jamal Khashoggi, North Korea, Stan Lee: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Amazon Chooses Queens and a Washington Suburb for Second Headquarters
description: SEATTLE  [Its official: Amazon said on Tuesday that it would open new offices in New York and Virginia. Read our updated coverage of the news here.]

title: How Rafael Espinal, Brooklyn Councilman and Public Advocate Candidate, Spends His Sundays
description: Rafael Espinal, 34, a New York City councilman who announced his candidacy for public advocate on Nov. 13, starts his Sundays at midnight on the sweaty dance floors of Brooklyn. In addition to creating the Office of Nightlife, Mr. Espinal helped abolish the Cabaret Law, which banned social dancing in many of the citys clubs and bars.

title: Eli Manning and the Giants Come Alive Late to Escape 49ers
description: The Giants appeared to be finished. They had fallen behind the 49ers, 20-10, in the third quarter and were struggling to match the effort of a young San Francisco team that did not seem to be aware that it was engaged in a race to the bottom of the N.F.L.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: Well Meet Again and She-Ra and the Princesses of Power
description: Grab those tissues: Well Meet Again is back for a second run. And a reboot of a 1980s animated series has its premiere on Netflix.

title: Australias Prime Minister Surprised by States Secret Deal With China
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Prime Minister Scott Morrison of Australia was blindsided by reports that a state government had quietly sidestepped federal regulators and signed a deal with China to participate in that countrys contentious Belt and Road infrastructure initiative.

title: In China, influencers rule
description: Chinese consumers are typically skeptical of brands and instead rely on peers, influencers, and celebrities to inform their purchasing choices, says Arnaud Roy, chief strategy officer at Launchmetrics. This is partly why Weibo and WeChat play such outsize roles in the Chinese consumers experience, from seeking inspiration and recommendations for products to researching brands and finally making a purchase.

title: Germanys Real Political Divide Is Generational
description: BERLIN  Germany is a peculiar country when it comes to good news about itself, too self-conscious and self-serious to accept anyones attempt to see it in a positive light. Every time a foreign newspaper writes about a German scientific achievement or the river surfers of Munich or the hipsters of Berlin, you can hear a low, collective moan: Were not cool, it says. Were tragic!

title: On Politics: Behind Florida Recount Furor, a G.O.P. Strategy
description: Good Tuesday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

title: Word + Quiz: iniquity
Caffeine
description: How much caffeine do you drink every day? In what form? How does it affect you? Do you ever worry that you are too dependent on it?

title: U.S. and China: one country, two systems
description: The United States and China have entirely intertwined economies  so much so that they can be thought of as one country operating under two systems, says Thomas Friedman. He sees the logic behind this relationship playing out over time, but adds that Trumps, being very different from past American presidents, will pose challenges for China.

title: WeWorks Rise: How a Sublet Start-Up Is Taking Over
description: Real estate titans have long scoffed at WeWork, which in eight short years has managed to attain a $20 billion valuation by selling short-term leases for shared office space with a mixture of stylish design and free-flowing alcohol.

title: Whitakers Appointment as Acting Attorney General Faces Court Challenge
description: WASHINGTON  In the days since President Trump ousted Attorney General Jeff Sessions and declared that he was installing Matthew G. Whitaker as the acting attorney general, many critics have challenged Mr. Whitakers fitness for the job. Some have gone further, calling his very appointment illegal.

title: Learning With: The Courage and Folly of a War That Left Indelible Scars
description: Before reading the article:

title: Shahidul Alam: Fiercely Devoted to the Truth
description: Update: A Bangladeshi court has granted Shahidul Alam bail after 102 days of detention.

title: U.N.s Expert on Extreme Poverty Is Investigating Britain. Why?
description: NEWCASTLE, England  At a food bank in a rundown part of northeast England, an unemployed mother and her adult son were having an odd morning. Denise and Michael Hunter typically come here for a quiet cuppa with the volunteers, a square meal and sometimes a food parcel or two.

title: Have You Noticed a New Attitude About Pimples?
description: In May, the Style section reported on a trend in skin positivity, exemplified by celebrities like Justin Bieber, Kendall Jenner and SZA all openly embracing their acne. Has this new movement made its way into teenage life? Have you noticed a new attitude about pimples?

title: Vegan or Vegetarian? You Have More Travel and Dining Options Than Ever
description: November is World Vegan Month, and with an increasing number of places catering to all types of vegan travelers, theres a lot to celebrate. (And perhaps not much to make fun of: The editor of a British food magazine recently lost his job over an email in which he ridiculed vegans.)

title: Weak Spots in Democrats Strong Midterm Results Point to Challenges in 2020
description: Democrats had a great showing in the 2018 midterm elections. But even in such a strong year, they sometimes struggled to match their traditional support in electorally significant areas  with serious implications for 2020.

title: New Public Spaces Are Supposed to Be for All. The Reality Is More Complicated.
description: Office workers sip coffee beside men sleeping in chairs pulled together. Tourists park their shopping bags where people shoot up heroin, or drink until they pass out. Panhandlers go table to table seeking handouts. Piles of trash, used needles and worse (human feces) have drawn complaints.

title: A Dream Vacation, Shaped by a Devastating Diagnosis
description: Dad, I love this place. My 18-year-old daughter, Maria, made my day with those five words as we made our sweaty way across Athens. Its different from any place Ive ever been.

title: Run a Marathon. Then, Quickly, Another.
description: Marathon runners can be compulsive beasts by nature. So it should be no surprise that a rising number of runners have decided to take their marathoning to the next level. Not by running ultra marathons, races that exceed the 26.2 miles of a standard marathon, but by running multiple marathons within a short period of time.

title: In Fiji, a Reluctant Swimmer Jumps In
description: Our columnist, Jada Yuan, is visiting each destination on our 52 Places to Go in 2018 list. This dispatch brings her to Fiji, which took the No. 24 spot. It is the 45th stop on Jadas itinerary.

title: Burned-Out Cars, Smoke in the Air, Aerial Assaults, All in California
description: MALIBU  A line of burned-out cars on the side of a road. The charred remains of an old pickup truck, brightened by a pristine American flag draped over the cab. Desperate residents fleeing, cars packed with people and family heirlooms, anything that could be frantically scooped up.

title: The U.S. Army Is Trying to Develop New Land Mines  Ones That Dont Harm Civilians
description: In the early 1990s, the end of the Cold War gave rise to a global movement to rid former war zones of land mines, which were littered across at least 68 countries. President Bill Clinton became the first world leader to call for their elimination on a global scale, but when it came time to formally ban them, the United States refused. Instead, over two decades, the United States invested $2.9 billion in demining projects and the destruction of other conventional weapons around the world. It has also destroyed millions of its own antipersonnel land mines, a weapon deemed particularly dangerous to civilians because it is buried underground and detonates when stepped on.

title: Are You a Firefighter Battling Californias Wildfires? We Want to Hear From You
description: Thousands of firefighters are working to combat the three fires that have been blazing in Northern and Southern California since last week, risking their lives to help others even as some of their own homes have been destroyed.

title: When Excellence Is a Survival Strategy
description: HEAVY An American Memoir By Kiese Laymon 241 pp. Scribner. $26.

title: Allonzo Trier Was the Basketball Kid on the Cover. Some Fraught Chapters Followed.
description: He was a sixth-grader from Seattle, a 13-year-old elite basketball prospect with arms that seemed endless. He stared straight into the camera for a photo shoot as his uniform shorts drooped toward his calves. Just 5-foot-5 and 110 pounds, he stood tall, self-assured.

title: Double the Children, Double the Challenge
description: Decorating a childs bedroom is hard enough when you have only one child. Add another to the mix and the challenges multiply.

title: Cosmopolitan Style in Turkey
description: Betl: I dont really have a style, I just find something that looks good and I wear it  skinny jeans, mom jeans. Usually, I match my hijab to my clothes. I have about 20 or 25 and they are different colors but very simple. I tie up my hijab differently based on what I am wearing and sometimes I wear a hat on top of it. When I want my outfit to pop out, I tie the hijab tight to prevent it from being main element of my outfit. The person who most influenced my clothing style is without doubt my mom. From time to time, Im inspired by her pictures from when she was young. However, Im also inspired from models or celebrities on Instagram. Because as we are living in an interactive world, its now possible to know how everyone else is dressed.

title: Colbert Slams Trump for Blaming Mismanagement for California Fires
description: Stephen Colbert expressed sympathy for the victims of the wildfires sweeping California  then slammed the less sympathetic response President Trump issued over the weekend. On Twitter, Trump blamed poor forest management for the fires and threatened to withhold federal funds for disaster relief.

title: Why It Feels Like Were Trapped in a Pinter Play
description: LONDON  Ten years after Harold Pinters death, it almost feels as if were trapped in one of his furrowed-brow-inducing plays. What is real? What is untrue? Why is everyone so creepy and annoying?

title: Why Michelle Obama Is Everything
description: A few days before the release of Michelle Obamas memoir, Becoming, I went to look at her portrait at the National Portrait Gallery to reflect on her evolving role in public life, and to talk to other women who were doing the same.

title: The Alt-Rights Favorite Meme Is 100 Years Old
description: At the chilling climax of William S. Linds 2014 novel Victoria, knights wearing crusaders crosses and singing Christian hymns brutally slay the politically correct faculty at Dartmouth College, the main characters (and Mr. Linds) alma mater. The work of slaughter went quickly, the narrator says. In less than five minutes of screams, shrieks and howls, it was all over. The floor ran deep with the bowels of cultural Marxism.

description: Ralph Lauren plans to open a store a week in China. But why open all these stores when so many of the customers can be reached online? For Patrice Louvet, president and C.E.O. of Ralph Lauren, stores are crucial for projecting the company as an aspirational company, one that provides experiences for its customers.

description: MINNEAPOLIS  When the Chinese billionaire Richard Liu was arrested two months ago in Minneapolis on suspicion of rape, he wasnt in town for business. Mr. Liu, a 45-year-old internet tycoon, was a student at the University of Minnesota, taking in lectures by day and enjoying dinner parties by night.

description: WASHINGTON  President Trump is moving toward major shuffles of his cabinet and his West Wing staff, as members of the Trump family are working to leave a mark on personnel decisions after a bruising midterm election cycle, several people familiar with the discussions said on Tuesday.

description: In sports, the team that loses is the team that studies the game-day tapes the hardest. In the military, its called an after-action review. Businesses that dont examine loss die.

title: A Week After the Election, Democratic Gains Grow Stronger
description: The 2018 midterm election looked last Tuesday like a serious but not crippling setback for Republicans, yet the picture has grown grimmer for the party since then as a more complete tally of votes has come in across the country.

title: In Prison for 16 Years, and Still Waiting for a Verdict
description: MEXICO CITY  Time seems to have stopped inside cell number six of Barrientos state prison, where Daniel Garca has been held for more than 16 years without a verdict.

title: Blasphemy Laws: An Excuse for Persecution
description: It is good news that Pakistans Supreme Court has acquitted and freed a Pakistani Christian woman who had already spent eight years on death row for blasphemy. In a 56-page ruling, the three justices said Asia Bibi, a farmworker in her early 50s, was the victim of mob justice aroused by unsubstantiated claims of what she said about the Prophet Muhammad in an exchange with women angry that she had sipped water from a cup used by Muslims.

title: Trump Assails Macron and Defends Decision to Skip Cemetery Visit
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump issued a blistering personal attack on Tuesday against President Emmanuel Macron of France, his host last weekend, and sought to douse a furor over his decision not to visit a cemetery of American soldiers while in France because of rain.

title: CNN Sues Trump Administration for Barring Jim Acosta From White House
description: CNN sued the Trump administration on Tuesday in an effort to reinstate the press credentials of its chief White House correspondent, Jim Acosta, escalating a dispute that has highlighted the increasingly tense dynamic between President Trump and the news media.

title: Stan Lees 11 Best Cameos and Where to Stream Them
description: Stan Lee, the one-time editor in chief, publisher and chairman of Marvel Comics, died on Monday at age 95. Born Stanley Martin Lieber in New York City in 1922, Lee lived to see many of his comic-book creations take over the silver screen: Since 2008, the Marvel Cinematic Universe has churned out 20 films that have grossed over $17 billion worldwide. Lee had cameos in all of them, not to mention bit parts in other films, TV shows, and even video games, starting with a tiny role as a jury member in the 1989 TV movie, The Trial of the Incredible Hulk. (This YouTube video rounds up most of them.) These are the 11 we think are most memorable, along with information on where to stream the films and series in which they appear.

title: Who Has the Copyright Over My Cheese?
description: A Dutch cheese company tried to claim that it had a monopoly on the taste of a cheese spread. The Court of Justice of the European Union weighed arguments from two competing food producers, and decided on Tuesday that a taste cannot be copyrighted.

title: Catholic Church Reforms Should Begin With Bishops
description: Several hundred Catholic bishops from around the country have gathered in Baltimore for a national meeting at a time when many of us faithful are grieving, angry and running out of patience. The horrifying scale of the clergy sexual abuse crisis, as chronicled by a Pennsylvania grand jury report in August that revealed widespread abuse and cover-up over several decades, underscores an obvious but essential point: Bishops cant be trusted to police themselves.
